[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Type parameter explosion] Can deeply nested generic types with multiple parameters cause exponential cost calculation (e.g., Vec<Vec<Vec<...>>> with N levels)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Memory consumption vs metered cost] Does the complexity metering correlate with actual memory consumption during module loading, or can low-cost modules still exhaust memory? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Constant: COST_PER_TYPE_NODE] [Cost constant calibration] Is COST_PER_TYPE_NODE (8) properly calibrated against actual VM execution cost, or can attackers find type structures that consume 10x or 100x more resources than the metered cost? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Constant: COST_PER_IDENT_BYTE] [Identifier cost accuracy] Is COST_PER_IDENT_BYTE (1) sufficient to prevent DoS via extremely long identifiers, considering parsing, hashing, and string operations on identifiers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Constant: Missing constants] [Instruction cost missing] Why is there no COST_PER_INSTRUCTION constant for bytecode instructions, and does this allow instruction-count-based DoS attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Constant: Missing constants] [Field count cost missing] Why is there no cost per struct field, allowing structs with thousands of fields to bypass complexity limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Constant: Missing constants] [Constant pool cost missing] Why aren't constant pool entries metered, allowing large constant pools to bypass complexity checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: meter_struct_defs()] [Variant explosion] Can enums with hundreds of variants, each with multiple fields, bypass complexity limits since only variant names and field nodes are charged? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: meter_struct_defs()] [Enum type parameter complexity] Do enum type parameters multiply the complexity of all variants, and is this properly metered or can generic enums with many variants bypass limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: signature_token_cost()] [Function type cost] Function signature tokens (closures) only charge COST_PER_TYPE_NODE - does this properly account for closure capture complexity and environment size? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: signature_token_cost()] [Vector nesting] Can deeply nested vectors (Vec<Vec<Vec<...>>>) create exponential runtime complexity that isn't reflected in the linear preorder_traversal cost? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: signature_token_cost()] [Type parameter shadowing] Can type parameters be shadowed or reused in ways that cause the same type parameter index to be counted multiple times or zero times? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: safe_get_table()] [Table size manipulation] If table sizes are attacker-controlled in the binary format, can tables with u32::MAX entries be declared to bypass complexity checks while the actual content is lazy-loaded? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Binary format version] Does complexity checking account for different Move binary format versions, or can older versions with different encoding bypass modern complexity limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Malformed binary handling] If the binary format is malformed but passes basic deserialization, can it cause incorrect complexity metering that allows complex modules through? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: check_module_complexity()] [Budget source] Where does the budget parameter come from, and can attackers manipulate it through transaction parameters or module metadata? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: check_module_complexity()] [Caller validation] Do callers of check_module_complexity properly handle the PROGRAM_TOO_COMPLEX error, or do some code paths treat it as a non-fatal warning? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Upgrade path] Can existing modules that were validated with an older, more lenient complexity checker be re-validated with stricter limits, or are they grandfathered in? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Dependency complexity] Does complexity checking account for module dependencies, or can a module import complex dependencies to bypass its own complexity limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-binary-format/src/check_complexity.rs] [Function: Multiple] [Module loading cost] Does complexity checking account for the actual cost of loading and verifying the module, or only the runtime execution cost? (Medium)
